page.title: 04Government Flintham-Syerston
page.content:
Flintham is the last village in Rushcliffe District Council, Syerston the first in Newark District Council. Flintham has a{Parish Council}of seven, six men and a woman, and is mainly involved in planning matters and the upkeep of village amenities. The Parish Council has recently bought land at Inholms Gardens to be used as a public open space. Syerston has an annual Parish Meeting and consequently fewer powers.
The{school}in Flintham has a governing body of twelve and there is a separate group of Trustees for the Old School which belongs to the L.E.A. during school hours, reverting to the village after 3.30pm.
Both{churches}have Parochial Church Councils.
